title:
A Multimodal Soft Gripper with Variable Stiffness and Variable Gripping
  Range Based on MASH Actuator
authors: Dannuo Li, Xuanyi Zhou, Quan Xiong and Chen-Hua Yeow
abstract:
Soft pneumatic actuators with integrated strain limiting layers have emerged
as predominant components in the field of soft gripper technology for several
decades. However, owing to their intrinsic strain-limiting layer design, these
soft grippers possess a singular gripping functionality, rendering them
incapable of adapting to diverse gripping tasks with different strategies.
Based on our previous work, we introduce a novel soft gripper that offers
variable stiffness, an adjustable gripping range, and multifunctionality. The
MASH actuator based soft gripper can expand its gripping range up to threefold
compared to the original configuration and ensures secure grip by enhancing
stiffness when handling heavy objects. Moreover, it supports multitasking
gripping through specific gripping strategy control.
